20.49.text:
Guy's and St Thomas' Charity
is an independent place-based

25.02.text:
And we work in the London
Boroughs of Lambeth and Suffolk

29.73.text:
And what we really
care about is,

31.83.text:
how do you work with
communities to really make

34.11.text:
a significant dent in the most
complex health challenges.

37.41.text:
So we're working with Nesta
and partnering with Nesta

39.63.text:
because we think these
people-powered health

41.46.text:
approaches are the
best route into making

51.48.text:
What's really different
about the charity

54.48.text:
is that we only work
in Lambeth and Suffolk,

57.51.text:
and we're one of the
UK's largest foundations.

60.03.text:
And that means that we can
do a lot of different things

65.12.text:
So we want to work with
loads of different people.

67.20.text:
We want to work with
our local communities,

68.99.text:
but also people from
outside London and Suffolk

71.61.text:
to almost look at it as a sort
of test-bed for innovation

82.27.text:
I think people-powered
health is brilliant.

85.87.text:
It's both a philosophy and a
very practical set of tools

91.67.text:
And the philosophy is,
nothing about us without us

97.96.text:
And that feels to
be very powerful.

99.97.text:
And underneath that there
are all these tools,

101.89.text:
be it about social movements
or user-centered design.

105.31.text:
They're all trying to put
people at their heart.

108.44.text:
And what we know as a foundation
is that unless you put people

112.54.text:
at the centre of what you're
trying to design then you

115.27.text:
don't really respond to the
challenges that they face

117.82.text:
and you don't really deal with
the complexity of the health

120.37.text:
issues that might
be addressing them.

128.33.text:
A really wonderful example
of people-powered health

131.36.text:
is something called PACT,
parents and communities

135.38.text:
And it's a day care
centre in Lambeth.

138.47.text:
And it's a co-produce thing
where Citizens UK worked with

142.17.text:
the communities and mothers
around Camberwell asking,

145.62.text:
well what do you really need
for the day care centre?

148.44.text:
And it came out with some
really brilliant ideas

150.44.text:
that I don't think anybody
else would have come up with.

153.38.text:
So, brilliant example, they came
up this idea of a baby swap.

156.92.text:
It's not where you
swap babies, but it's

159.02.text:
where mothers bring
the sorts of things

161.18.text:
that their babies
no longer need,

162.65.text:
and other mothers can
grab them for free.

165.02.text:
And what's really clever about
that is a statutory sector

168.53.text:
has placed nurses and
midwives in there.

171.89.text:
And so it's a great
way for communities

174.35.text:
to meet the statutory sector
and bring the sort of people who

177.38.text:
might never actually really
talk to a nurse or a midwife

181.11.text:
And I think that's a wonderful
example of people-powered

183.53.text:
health and putting
people at the centre.

191.93.text:
I think people-powered
health is going to transform

196.40.text:
But we need to
help it get there.

198.17.text:
So, that for me means we need
to have really broad coalitions

202.70.text:
that combine communities
with civic society,

207.35.text:
with the statutory
sector, with business.

210.30.text:
And we also need to
think really hard

212.21.text:
about the context in which
people live to make sure

215.18.text:
that we're not just
focusing on being centred

218.97.text:
around the person,
but we're also

220.34.text:
being focused on being
led by the person.

229.52.text:
What needs to happen
next is that people need

231.50.text:
to come to Lambeth and
Suffolk and come work

233.33.text:
with guys in the
St. Thomas' charity

234.83.text:
because we're really
interested in saying,

236.96.text:
can you take a whole load of
these people-powered health

239.54.text:
approaches-- can you apply
them to a small set of health

242.66.text:
issues, and see if
putting them all together

245.66.text:
they add up to more than
the sum of their parts.
